meanings.definition: A person who conforms to accepted behavior or established practices.
meanings.sent1: The school's strict conformist always followed the rules without question.
meanings.sent2: She was considered a conformist because she always did what everyone else was doing.
meanings.sent3: The conformist sheep in the flock never strayed from the herd.
meanings.sent4: In a world of rebels, he stood out as a shining example of a conformist.
meanings.sent5: The conformist's uniformity made them blend seamlessly into the crowd.

meanings.definition: In accordance with prevailing social standards or conventions.
meanings.sent1: Her conformist choice of clothing matched perfectly with the dress code.
meanings.sent2: The party had a conformist atmosphere where everyone behaved politely.
meanings.sent3: The conformist decorations at the event were so traditional yet charming.
meanings.sent4: His conformist haircut was so typical, it seemed like it came straight from a magazine.
meanings.sent5: The conformist mindset of the group kept them from exploring new ideas.
